closed note (near Erzsébetváros, 7th district) / * 2019 November 11 06:48 彭貴熙 Created: "文創二手市集" / POI name: Gozsdu udvar / POI types: psurface-paved_good highway-footway-tunnel / OSM data version: 2019-10-19T16:52:54Z / #mapsme / * 2019 November 16 19:21 ITineris Updated: Can you explain it in English or in Hungarian? For the above jibberish, Google Translate says: "Wenchuang second-hand market" which this place is clearly not. / * 2019 December 10 18:37 feket Updated: maybe this one: https://www.weekendmarket.hu/hu/fooldal/ / But I don't know its exact place. / Kizárt dolog, hogy hétvégén a Gozsdu közelébe merészkedjek, valaki másnak kell felmérni ;) / opening_hours=Mar-Sep: Fr 10:00-17:00; Sa-Su 10:00-17:00 / * 2022 March 21 19:47 Hungarian_user Resolved:

closed note (near Lipótváros, 5th district) / * 2021 July 18 07:01 Mateusz Konieczny Created: https://www.openstreetmap.org/way/6064697/history - is it open or not? / It is right now mentioning being closed in description, marked as conbstruction finished but still with contruction tag... / Though I see access=no - is active construction (highway=construction construction=) complete and they put some finishing touches/inspecting while they keep it closed? / applies to all parts of the bridge / * 2021 July 18 09:51 ottwiz Updated: As far as i'm concerned, Széchenyi Lánchíd is closed because it's getting renovated. There are some articles about it. / https://hungarytoday.hu/chain-bridge-renovation-closed-pedestrians-cars/ / * 2021 July 18 09:51 ottwiz Updated: Actually, it's gonna stay closed for cars until 2022 and for pedestrian-bike traffic until 2023 / * 2021 July 19 05:11 Mateusz Konieczny Updated: I would set correct opening_date at https://www.openstreetmap.org/way/172699280#map=18/47.49901/19.04375&layers=N / https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Key:opening%20date "An approximated date in the future when a construction will be finished" / Note that start_date=* is for what opening_date is used right now / * 2021 July 19 05:12 Mateusz Konieczny Updated: But start_date is also set so not sure how to resolve it... / * 2022 March 20 15:37 Hungarian_user Resolved:
